Entries.default: "Keep moving. This here is for the crew of the Divine Barge. You ain't part of it, so you ain't getting inside."
"Hey, you look like me. Maybe you could be part of the Divine Barge after all!"
"Well, look here, one of Berath's blessed. Maybe you could be part of the Divine Barge after all!"
"Hey, you're one of Ondra's blessed, just like Captain Tatzatl! He'd probably like you."
"Always good to see one of Magran's blessed. Have a bunch on our crew. Good fighters, all of them."
"Does that mean I can come in?"
"I'm looking for a man named Giacolo."
"Farewell."
"Sure doesn't. Now get outta here!"
"Have you tried the Wild Mare in Neketaka? I'm sure they have a boy or two who would let you call them Giacolo for a couple of hours."
"I know Giacolo is in there."
"Smart mouth. I wonder how smart it would be without any teeth."
"Doesn't matter what you know or think you know. You ain't gettin' in."
"Here's how this goes. You knock my teeth out, my boys knock Giacolo's brains out before you darken the captain's doorway."
"You seem a little slow, so let me know if I need to explain it again. Otherwise, get outta here!"
"I'll be back."
[Attack] "I'll take my chances."
"Farewell."

"Hey boys! Someone's out here lookin' for a fight!"

From the other side of the door, you can hear the sounds of muffled talking and rapid footsteps.
"You again. What do you want?"
"Open this door or I'll use your corpse to break it down."
"Per complanca, let us pass. I know you have Giacolo. I have known him since I was a girl in the Republics."
"So? Why should I care?"
"He saved my life. He's saved the lives of many of our kind. Whatever you think he's done, you have the wrong idea about him."

"Ehh..."

A grimace twists her face. She rubs the fur on her right ear, looks to the door, then to you.
"She's telling the truth."
"Why are you looking at me? You can't make up your own mind?"
[Attack] "Too slow."
"Fine. I probably won't live to regret this."
"All right, all right. You made your point."
"I'm in the good graces of the Pr√≠ncipi. Surely that should count for something."
"Listen, I'm from the Dyrwood. We don't lick someone's boots just because they're important."
"I won't even curtsy when I throw your ass out of here. Now get!"
She turns to the door while sliding a key from a pouch at her waist. With a quick twist, the door is unlocked and opened.

"After you."

She motions to the door.
[Nod.]
